meanings: going out of one's way (to do)

lessons.japanese: 君がわざわざそこにいく必要はない。
lessons.english: You need not take the trouble to go there.

lessons.japanese: 遠いところを、わざわざおいでくださってありがとうございます。
lessons.english: Thank you very much for coming all the way to see me.

lessons.japanese: わざわざ彼を訪ねて行かなくてもよい。
lessons.english: Don't bother to call on him.

lessons.japanese: わざわざ当社までお出でいただくには及びません。
lessons.english: Please don't go to the trouble of coming to our office.

lessons.japanese: わざわざ電話をかけてくださらなくてけっこうです。
わざわざ電話していただくには及びません。
わざわざ助けてくださるなんて、あなたはご親切です。
lessons.english: It is kind of you go out of your way to help me.

lessons.japanese: わざわざ傘を持ってこなくてもよい。
lessons.english: You don't have to go to the trouble of getting an umbrella.

lessons.japanese: わざわざ見送りに来て下さってありがとう。
lessons.english: Thank you very much for coming all the way to see me off.

lessons.japanese: わざわざ迎えに来るようなことはしないで下さい。
lessons.english: Don't take the trouble to come and meet me.

lessons.japanese: わざわざ会いに来てくれてありがとう。
lessons.english: Thank you for coming all the way to see me.

lessons.japanese: わざわざ家まで送っていただいてありがとう。
lessons.english: Thank you very much for driving me all the way to my house.
